alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Dougherty (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 14 at 4:08PM EDT until June 14 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM EDT FOR DOUGHERTY...SOUTHWESTERN LEE...EASTERN CALHOUN AND SOUTHEASTERN TERRELL COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN GEORGIA... At 408 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Morgan, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Morgan, Albany, Putney, Leary, East Albany, Marine Corps Logistics Base, Turner City, Walker, Stocks, Radium Springs, Forrester, Lockett Crossing, South Albany, Southwest Ga Regional A/P, Palmyra, Holt, Acree, Williamsburg, Century and Pecan City. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for south central and southwestern Georgia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
